intro: Geraniospermum peltatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, orbicular leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. It is adapted to arid environments and stores water in its succulent stems. The plant is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
